riddle:
Where Lady Liberty stands tall and proud,
In harbor waters, a beacon to the crowd.
Five boroughs unite in endless dance,
Skyscrapers pierce clouds in finance's romance.
Central Park's heart beats green and strong,
Yellow cabs weave their urban song.
The city that never sleeps, they say,
Empire State dreams light the way.

Big Ben chimes through misty air,
Thames flows past with regal flair.
Royal guards in crimson stand,
Tower Bridge spans ancient land.
Piccadilly's lights aglow,
In Camden Market, stories flow.
Where crown jewels catch the light,
City's heart beats day and night.

Neon dreams in cherry blossom nights,
Shinkansen speeds past temple lights.
Shibuya's crossing, souls cascade,
In zen gardens, traditions fade.
Mount Fuji watches from afar,
As manga tales meet rising star.
Where old and new in harmony blend,
Imperial grounds where dragons tend.

Iron lady reaches to the sky,
Seine's waters slowly passing by.
Café aromas fill the air,
Notre-Dame stands in silent prayer.
Louvre's glass pyramid gleams at dawn,
Montmartre artists' dreams spawn.
City of Light, romance's home,
Beneath stars, lovers freely roam.

Opera House sails catch the breeze,
Harbour Bridge spans southern seas.
Bondi's waves crash and spray,
As cockatoos greet breaking day.
Circular Quay's ferries glide,
Manly Beach's rolling tide.
Where Pacific meets the shore,
Southern Cross watches o'er.

Gateway arches to Arabian seas,
Dharavi's spirit never flees.
Dabbawalas race through monsoon rain,
Chowpatty's crowds grow once again.
Colaba's lanes hold stories old,
Marine Drive's queens necklace gold.
Where Bollywood dreams take their flight,
Maximum City burns bright.

Christ the Redeemer's arms spread wide,
Copacabana's rolling tide.
Sugar Loaf at sunset glows,
Samba rhythms as night grows.
Carnival colors fill the street,
Ipanema's golden heat.
Where mountains meet the sea so blue,
Favelas climb for ocean's view.

Pyramids pierce desert skies,
Sphinx's riddles ancient wise.
Nile flows as it always has,
Khan el-Khalili's bustling jazz.
Minarets call through the day,
Coptic churches where some pray.
Where pharaohs once did rule this land,
Modern life meets desert sand.

Saint Basil's domes touch the stars,

Red Square echoes marching feet,
Metro stations, art complete.
Moscow River winds its way,
Arbat artists greet the day.
Where golden rings of churches shine,
Imperial dreams through space and time.

Where walls once split east from west,
A city healed, put time to test.

Kurfürstendamm draws the crowd.

From Reichstag's dome to Spree's flow,
Unity's spirit continues to grow.

Aztec temples beneath modern streets,
Where past and present gently meet.
Zócalo's heart beats proud and strong,
Xochimilco's boats drift along.
Chapultepec's castle stands high,
Reforma's angel guards the sky.
Where ancient gods still hold their sway,
In valley depths where eagles lay.

Table Mountain wears its cloud,

Waterfront where seals do play,

Where two oceans meet and merge,

Where Merlion guards the bay,
Gardens by the Bay display

Where future's dreams aren't too far.

Harbourfront where boats do sway,
Streetcars rolling on their way.

Beneath the tower's majesty.

Where East meets West across the strait,

Where sultans' dreams still remain,

Tall houses lean in gentle sway,

In a land where waters weave a tale of two,
A city stands, its heart split in view.
Nobel's prize and ancient viking lore,
Bridges connect what once was more.
Where northern lights might grace the sky,
And meatballs with lingonberries lie,
A palace royal and museums grand,
Name this city of the northern land.

Where olive trees and legends grow.
